Caroline_Kole:
{{Short description|American singer, songwriter and musician}}
'''Caroline Kole''' (born Caroline Kudelko; July 2, 1997) is an American singer, [[songwriter]], and [[guitarist]] who began performing under the stage name Suite Caroline.<ref name=Daly>Daly, Sean. [https://www.tampabay.com/clearwaters-caroline-kole-touring-with-reba-mcentire-signs-national-record/2130919/ "Clearwater's Caroline Kole Touring with Reba McEntire; signs national record, publishing deals"] , tampabay.com, July 11, 2013.</ref>

==Career==
Kole records under the Starstruck Records label and has a publishing contract with [[Sony/ATV]].<ref name=Daly /><ref name=Kole>[http://carolinekole.com "Caroline Kole"] Starstruck Management Group. Accessed March 12, 2015</ref>  Beginning in 2013, she was on a two-year international tour with [[Reba McEntire]], opening shows for the performer.<ref name=Kole /><ref name=schatter>[http://www.countryschatter.com/2015/03/caroline-kole-lighting-up-the-country-music-world "Caroline Kole lighting up the country music world"], March 4, 2015.</ref> She was also one of the singers featured on [[Reba McEntire]]'s release "Pray for Peace".<ref name=Swirsky>Swirsky, Jen [http://www.cmchatlive.com/reba-releases-pray-for-peace-video "Reba Releases "Pray for Peace"], cmchatlive.com, July 21, 2014</ref>

In 2013, Starstruck Records released a five-track EP of Kole's, including the single "Money to Me".<ref name=Caroline>[https://www.tampabay.com/the-top-10-tampa-music-stories-of-2013-no-5-caroline-koles-breakout-year/2156659/ "The top 10 Tampa music stories of 2013, No. 5: Caroline Kole's breakout year"] , tampabay.com, December 26, 2013.</ref><ref name=Reverbnation>[https://www.tampabay.com/the-top-10-tampa-music-stories-of-2013-no-5-caroline-koles-breakout-year/2156659/ Caroline Kole profile] , tampabay.com; accessed March 13, 2015</ref> That release reached the number one spot on the [[Country Music Television]] (CMT) Pure Countdown.<ref name=schatter/> The video from her second release, "If He'd Ever Look Up", was number one for several weeks on CMT Pure, and CMT also named her a "Listen Up" Artist.<ref name=schatter/><ref name=Homeless>[http://www.lebanondemocrat.com/article/living/561431 "Reba, teen singer join cause to help homeless"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402100553/http://www.lebanondemocrat.com/article/living/561431 |date=2015-04-02 }}, lebanondemocrat.com, February 1, 2015</ref> Both songs have also been featured on SiriusXM satellite radio.<ref name=Homeless/><ref name=Love>[http://www.countrymusicislove.com/country-music-news/introducing-caroline-kole "Introducing Caroline Kole"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402183613/http://www.countrymusicislove.com/country-music-news/introducing-caroline-kole/ |date=2015-04-02 }}, countrymusicislove.com, January 14, 2014</ref>
 
Kole has an endorsement arrangement with [[Martin Guitars]].<ref name=CMT>[https://web.archive.org/web/20130913121126/http://www.cmt.com/artists/caroline-kole/ "Caroline Kole"], cmt.com; accessed March 11, 2015.</ref> She was 12 years old when she was first promoted by the company at the [[NAMM Show]].<ref name=Kinsler>Kinsler, Robert [http://www.ocregister.com/soundcheck/strong-480754-namm-http.html Profile], ocregister.com, January 26, 2010.</ref> At age 14, she began playing at the County Music Association (CMA) Festival.<ref name=Z>Z, Jessica. [https://archive.today/20150407164433/http://www.keepinitcountryblog.com/2012/06/caroline-kole-cma-fest-appearance "Caroline Kole Makes Her First CMA Fest Appearance"],  keepinitcountryblog.com, June 16, 2012.</ref>

In addition to McEntire, Kole has performed on stage with [[Charlie Daniels]], [[Pat Benatar]], and [[Sheryl Crow]]. She has opened shows for artists such as [[Blake Shelton]], [[Alan Jackson]], [[Eric Church]] and [[Martina McBride]].<ref name=Byrd>Byrd, Steve. [http://www.guitargirlmag.com/interviews/caroline-kole--tampa-bay-favorite-goes-for-big-time-in-nashville "Caroline Kole: Tampa Bay Favorite Goes for Big Time in Nashville"], guitargirlmag.com, February 28, 2013.</ref>
 
"Winter", a song Kole wrote about the dolphin featured in the Warner Brothers movies ''[[Dolphin Tale]]'' and ''[[Dolphin Tale 2]]'', appears on the soundtrack of the documentary ''Winter, the Dolphin that Can''.<ref name=seewinter>[http://www.seewinter.com/winter-hope/real-life-story/caroline-kole Caroline Kole profile], seewinter.com; accessed  March 12, 2015</ref><ref name=Dolphin>[http://www.seewinter.com/winter-hope/dolphin-tale-1-2. "Dolphin Tale 1 & 2”] Clearwater Marine Aquarium. Accessed March 12, 2015</ref><ref name=Frequency>[http://www.frequency.com/video/hey-winter-dolphin-fans-check-out/144789277/-/5-89809 “Hey Winter Dolphin Fans”] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150623231123/http://www.frequency.com/video/hey-winter-dolphin-fans-check-out/144789277/-/5-89809 |date=2015-06-23 }}, frequency.com; accessed March 12, 2015.</ref>

In May 2018, via Starstruck Records, Caroline Kole made her transition from country to pop with a self-titled EP release featuring the singles "Right Now", "Adamantine", and "Ghost". Kole has solidified her move to pop music with her latest July 2018 release of "What If".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://atwoodmagazine.com/ckwi-caroline-kole-what-if/|title=Premiere: Caroline Kole Asks "What If" with Electro-Pop Brilliance and Bravado - Atwood Magazine|date=2018-07-13|access-date=2018-07-25|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.popdust.com/caroline-kole-music-2586755114.html|title=Music Monday Caroline Kole|date=2018-07-16|work=Popdust|access-date=2018-07-25|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.musicmusingsandsuch.com/musicmusingsandsuch/2018/7/26/interview-caroline-kole|title=INTERVIEW: Caroline Kole|work=Music Musings & Such|access-date=2018-07-26|language=en-US}}</ref> Her latest song released in 2019 is a single titled "Freaking Out!" This was released shortly after the two singles; "Missing Each Other" and "Easy."

In 2023, Caroline auditioned for [[American Idol (season 21)|season 21]] of American Idol.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://countrynow.com/caroline-kole-who-has-toured-with-reba-mcentire-turns-heads-with-american-idol-audition/ | title=Caroline Kole, Who Has Toured with Reba McEntire, Turns Heads with 'American Idol' Audition | date=27 February 2023 }}</ref>
